highlights.highlight: Chino Commercial Bancorp (OTC: CCBC) reported a 25.04% increase in net earnings for Q2 2025, totaling $1.54 million. The newly opened Corona branch attracted $20 million in new deposits within the quarter. Net interest margin improved significantly from 2.95% to 3.69% year-over-year.

Chino Commercial Bancorp (OTC: CCBC) announced robust financial results for the second quarter of 2025, with net earnings reaching $1.54 million, marking a 25.04% increase compared to the same period in 2024. The company's earnings per share rose to $0.48 from $0.38, reflecting a notable year-over-year improvement.

Total assets of Chino Commercial Bancorp grew to $481.9 million, up by 3.3% from December 2024, while deposits surged by 6.5% to $371.6 million. The company's core deposits represented 97.01% of total deposits, indicating strong stability and customer retention.
